ygData.subject: RE: Lute of the Gypsy Princess un-nerfed? DOUBLE the ef fect?!
ygData.msgSnippet: 45 a tic??  I would be highly suspect of that.  That is far too powerful (i.e. too good to be true).  Clerics everywhere would blow a gasket if they heard
ygData.messageBody:
45 a tic?? I would be highly suspect of that. That is far too powerful
(i.e. too good to be true). Clerics everywhere would blow a gasket if they
heard about that.

Desmei Sightblinder
Lvl 30 Bard (Povar)

> -----Original Message-----
> From: jay schultze [mailto:sartori69@...]
> Sent: Monday, October 11, 1999 5:51 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Lute of the Gypsy Princess un-nerfed? DOUBLE the
> effect?!
>
>
> From: "jay schultze" <sartori69@...>
>
> Well, a guildmate of mine stated today that he is now able to
> heal 45 points
> per tick with his Lute of the Gypsy Princess found in
> Mistmoore. He is a lvl
> 45 bard. Can anyone verify this info? I was not near him to
> test it out, and
> he blows alot of hot air at times. So I just wanted to see
> if anyone else
> is experiencing this insane (that's not a complaint) rise in
> our bretheren's
> ability to heal with song.
>
> This info blew my mind (not to mention irritated the hell out
> of my cleric
> gf, heheheh). I had never bothered to get this item because I
> knew that it
> was nerfed and worked only as well as a regular stringed
> instrument. I also
> hate Castle Mistmoore. =) Whatever Verant was planning on
> doing with this
> item as far as magical properties, I NEVER expected this!
> Does this also
> mean our lvl 2 and lvl 48 DoT songs are that much more
> powerful? <evil grin>
>
> Anyone, someone please test and post as I do not have the
> item available to
> do so myself. =(
>
> Sartori D'Elsiraad <The Companions>
> Bard of Kelethin of the 48th Chorus
> Veeshan
>
